TITLE: Import and Basic Usage - jsPDF-AutoTable DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import jsPDF and jsPDF-AutoTable, create a jsPDF document, and generate a table from either an HTML table or Javascript data. It also shows how to save the PDF. SOURCE: https://github.com/simonbengtsson/jspdf-autotable/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { jsPDF } from 'jspdf' import { autoTable } from 'jspdf-autotable' const doc = new jsPDF() // It can parse html: //
autoTable(doc, { html: '#my-table' }) // Or use javascript directly: autoTable(doc, { head: [['Name', 'Email', 'Country']], body: [ ['David', 'david@example.com', 'Sweden'], ['Castille', 'castille@example.com', 'Spain'], // ... ], }) doc.save('table.pdf') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Apply Plugin Directly - jsPDF-AutoTable DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to apply the jsPDF-AutoTable plugin directly to the jsPDF document object. It imports the necessary modules, applies the plugin, creates a jsPDF document, and then uses the `autoTable` method directly on the document object to generate a table. Finally, it saves the generated PDF. SOURCE: https://github.com/simonbengtsson/jspdf-autotable/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { jsPDF } from 'jspdf' import { applyPlugin } from 'jspdf-autotable' applyPlugin(jsPDF) const doc = new jsPDF() doc.autoTable({ html: '#my-table' }) doc.save('table.pdf') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CDN Usage Example - jsPDF-AutoTable DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use jsPDF and jsPDF-AutoTable with downloaded or CDN dist files. It includes the necessary script tags for jsPDF and the autotable plugin, and then uses them to create a PDF document with a table. SOURCE: https://github.com/simonbengtsson/jspdf-autotable/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cell Styling Example - jsPDF-AutoTable DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an example of how to use colspan, rowspan and inline cell styles when defining a table with jsPDF-AutoTable. The code creates a jsPDF document and defines a table body with a single cell that spans two columns and two rows, with centered horizontal alignment. SOURCE: https://github.com/simonbengtsson/jspdf-autotable/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` autoTable(doc, { body: [ [{ content: 'Text', colSpan: 2, rowSpan: 2, styles: { halign: 'center' } }], ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Column Styling Example - jsPDF-AutoTable DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use columnStyles to style specific columns within a jsPDF-AutoTable table. It also shows how to use the columns property to control which data is included in the table and assign dataKeys. SOURCE: https://github.com/simonbengtsson/jspdf-autotable/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // Example usage with columnStyles, autoTable(doc, { styles: { fillColor: [255, 0, 0] }, columnStyles: { 0: { halign: 'center', fillColor: [0, 255, 0] } }, // Cells in first column centered and green margin: { top: 10 }, body: [ ['Sweden', 'Japan', 'Canada'], ['Norway', 'China', 'USA'], ['Denmark', 'China', 'Mexico'], ], }) // Example usage of columns property. Note that America will not be included even though it exist in the body since there is no column specified for it. autoTable(doc, { columnStyles: { europe: { halign: 'center' } }, // European countries centered body: [ { europe: 'Sweden', america: 'Canada', asia: 'China' }, { europe: 'Norway', america: 'Mexico', asia: 'Japan' }, ], columns: [ { header: 'Europe', dataKey: 'europe' }, { header: 'Asia', dataKey: 'asia' }, ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Drawing Image in Cell using didDrawCell Hook - JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use the `didDrawCell` hook to add an image to a specific cell within a jsPDF-AutoTable table. It checks if the current cell is in the body section and the first column, then adds a base64 encoded image to that cell. Requires the jsPDF and jsPDF-AutoTable libraries. SOURCE: https://github.com/simonbengtsson/jspdf-autotable/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` // Example with an image drawn in each cell in the first column autoTable(doc, { didDrawCell: (data) => { if (data.section === 'body' && data.column.index === 0) { const base64Img = 'data:image/jpeg;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANS...' doc.addImage(base64Img, 'JPEG', data.cell.x + 2, data.cell.y + 2, 10, 10) } }, }) ```
